title: 105_hr2949
content: The Missouri and Middle Mississippi Rivers Enhancement Project is outlined in Section 1. The Middle Mississippi River and Missouri River Enhancement Project involves developing a plan to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat in the specified river reaches. The project is authorized by the Secretary of the Army. The plan for the Middle Mississippi River and Missouri River Enhancement Project includes activities to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat while considering water-related needs and private property rights. This involves modifying navigation structures to benefit habitat. The Middle Mississippi River and Missouri River Enhancement Project aims to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat through various activities such as creating side channels, restoring island habitat, and establishing criteria for prioritizing activities based on cost-effectiveness. The Secretary will implement these activities using allocated funds. The Secretary will implement activities described in the plan using allocated funds to accelerate completion of activities to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat of the Missouri River or the middle Mississippi River. The Secretary may also design and construct project features using existing authority if compatible with project purposes. Integration of other activities will be carried out as well. The Secretary will integrate activities with other Federal and State activities while carrying out the described activities. This section does not affect existing authorities unless expressly provided otherwise. The Secretary shall provide public participation and comply with applicable laws in developing and carrying out the plan and activities authorized by the Water Resources Development Act of 1986. No new regulatory authority is conferred by this section. The Secretary must comply with applicable Federal laws, including the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969. The non-Federal share of project costs should not exceed 25%, with a Federal share limit of $5,000,000 per activity. Operation and maintenance are the Federal responsibility. $50,000,000 is authorized for appropriations from 1999 to 2004, managed by the Mississippi Valley Division. From 1999 to 2004, $50,000,000 is authorized for appropriations, managed by the Mississippi Valley Division of the Army Corps of Engineers. The funds will be distributed to the appropriate Districts of the Army Corps of Engineers for management.
